name: NASA Facility
description: The hidden NASA base where crucial operations for humanity's survival in 'Interstellar' are held.

content.title: History
content.body: The NASA Facility, also known as the underground NASA base, was secretly re-established to find a new habitable planet for humanity as Earth becomes increasingly uninhabitable. Despite being officially disbanded, NASA continued its operations in secrecy to prevent widespread panic and to focus on Plan A and Plan B of saving humanity.

content.title: Geography
content.body: The facility is located underground and camouflaged as a mundane building to avoid detection. It exists in a remote region with no specific name mentioned, somewhere in the United States.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
- **Mission Control Room**: The heart of operations where missions are monitored and controlled.
- **Research and Development Areas**: Facilities dedicated to scientific research critical for the success of the Lazarus missions.
- **Launch Pads**: Areas for spacecraft launch preparations.
- **Living Quarters**: Accommodations for personnel working continuously on the project.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The NASA Facility plays a vital role in 'Interstellar' as it is where Cooper (Matthew McConaughey) is recruited into the Endurance mission to find a new world for humanity. It serves as the starting point of the space journey, highlighting the desperation and hopes pinned on space exploration for survival.
